metadata.value: The Nova typis transacta navigatio novi orbis India occidentalis is a fictionalized account of Benedictine missionaries such as Bernardo Buil who accompanied Columbus on his second voyage to the New World, written by Caspar Plautius and published in 1621. The book contains extraordinary engravings, attributed to Wolgang Kilian, which mix fantastical depictions of mythical creatures, cannibalism and barbarity with authentic details of local customs, flora and fauna. This image shows Native Americans riding a sea monster.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: The Nova typis transacta navigatio novi orbis Indiæ occidentalis is a fictionalized account of Benedictine missionaries such as Bernardo Buil who accompanied Columbus on his second voyage to the New World, written by Caspar Plautius and published in 1621. The book contains extraordinary engravings, attributed to Wolgang Kilian, which mix fantastical depictions of mythical creatures, cannibalism and barbarity with authentic details of local customs, flora and fauna. This image shows Native Americans riding a sea monster.
